content:
I’m a data scientist and PhD candidate in Geoscience who specializes in using data assimilation techniques to reconstruct past climates. My research focuses on combining natural climate archives, like tree-rings and ice-cores, with general circulation climate models. I also teach data science skills workshops for The Carpentries and the University of Arizona to help promote open, reproducible science.
  Download my CV or scroll for more information.
summary: I’m a data scientist and PhD candidate in Geoscience who specializes in using data assimilation techniques to reconstruct past climates. My research focuses on combining natural climate archives, like tree-rings and ice-cores, with general circulation climate models.
title: Jonathan King

summary: Workshops on many data science tools including Python, git, Bash, and more.
title: Resbaz 2021

content: We’re reconstructing the Southern Annular Mode (SAM) over the Common Era by applying data assimilation to drought atlases and the PAGES network of temperature sensitive climate proxies. The SAM is a major influence on Southern Hemisphere climate, and has impacts on storm tracks, drought, and ice melt. Understanding its past variations can help characterize its behavior and predict its response to future climate change.
summary: Assimilating drought Atlases and the PAGES network of temperature sensitive climate proxies to reconstruct the Southern Annular Mode over the last 2000 years
title: Reconstructing the Southern Annular Mode

content: DASH is a Matlab package that facilitates paleoclimate data assimilation workflows. It includes utilities to build and organize state vectors, estimate proxy values using proxy system models (PSMs), and implement Ensemble Kalman Filters, Particle Filters, and Optimal Sensor tests. It has been used to implement a number of recent scientific studies.
summary: A Matlab package for paleoclimate data assimilation workflow.
title: DASH

content: This workshop is designed to introduce scientists and academic reseachers to the Github platform. It covers fundamental git concepts (such as cloning, pushing, and branches), and provides demos showing how to implement common tasks using Github Desktop and the online Github website.
summary: An introduction to Github for scientists and academic researchers.
title: Github Workshop

content: We’re reconstructing surface temperatures in the Northern Hemisphere over the last millennium using data assimilation. This project focuses on the NTREND network, an expert-curated selection of temperature-sensitive tree ring records.
summary: Creating a temperature history of the Northern Hemisphere over the last millennium by assimilating by assimilating the NTREND tree-ring network.
title: NTREND Assimilation

summary: An introduction to Github for scientists and academic researchers.
title: Github Workshop

summary: Assimilating sea surface temperature proxies over the Last Glacial Maximum constrains equilibrium climate sensitivity.
title: Glacial cooling and climate sensitivity revisited

summary: Assimilating tree-ring records helps resolve discrepancies between simulated and reconstructed climate reponse to volcanism.
title: Resolving the differences in the simulated and reconstructed climate response to volcanism over the last millennium

summary: A sensitivity analysis of MEG computed reservoir temperatures.
title: Multireaction equilibrium geothermometry: A sensitivity analysis using data from the Lower Geyser Basin, Yellowstone National Park, USA

summary: We synthesize and characterize zinc sulfide nanotubes.
title: Direct growth by arc discharge and computational study of zinc sulfide nanotubes
Properties of transition metal doped cadmium sulfide hexamers and dodecamers

summary: We assimilating a highly-sensitive, small tree-ring network to reconstruct Northern Hemisphere temperatures over the Last Millennium.
title: A data assimilation approach to last millennium temperature field reconstruction using a limited high-sensitivity proxy network
